article.title: Revealing Short GRB Jet Structure and Dynamics with Gravitational Wave Electromagnetic Counterparts

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red dashed-dotted line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The probability of a GW detected system with a given inclination.
The mean system inclination for the distribution of GW detected systems.
The cumulative distribution of the probability of a system being inclined at a given angle.
The maximum detectable luminosity distance for a GW detected system.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the grey circle in the inset of Figure 2 represent?
choices: A typical Swift/BAT detectable short GRB.
A failed GRB with a low Lorentz factor.
A low-luminosity GRB at 40 Mpc just below the detection limit for Swift/BAT.
The density uncertainty of the ambient medium.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula Γ ≥ 80E<sub>51</sub><sup>1/5</sup> δt<sub>-1</sub><sup>-2/5</sup>  describe?
choices: The minimum Lorentz factor required for a successful GRB, considering the dissipation and photospheric radii.
The beaming angle of the afterglow emission relative to the jet axis.
The probability of a binary system being favorably inclined for GRB detection.
The relationship between the jet kinetic energy and the observed luminosity.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of jet structure is depicted in the bottom right panel of Figure 3?
